message_1: How many different ways can you rearrange the letters in the word "MATHS" if you use all the letters?
message_2:
To find the number of different ways to rearrange the letters in the word "MATHS," you can use the formula for permutations, which is n! (n factorial), where n is the number of letters in the word.

In this case, there are 5 letters in the word "MATHS," so the number of different ways to rearrange the letters is 5! (5 factorial).

5! = 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1 = 120

So, there are 120 different ways to rearrange the letters in the word "MATHS" if you use all the letters.
